page.title: 19STORNOWAY NORTH - EDUCATION
page.content:
{The Nicolson Institute In the Nicolson Institute there are 1365 pupils and 100 members of staff. It opened in 1873 and the best known ex pupil is probably Donnie B Macleod. The Nicolson Institute is a six year secondary school. First year pupils come from eight primary schools. The school also takes pupils from five junior secondary schools at third year and from the Uists and Barra in fifth year. The pupils from Uist and Barra stay in one of three hostels or in lodgings.
{Stornoway Primary School}opened in August 1969. There are 542 pupils and 24 staff. Most pupils come from Stornoway but some travel from Steinish, Point, Achmore and Laxdale
